content: betsy the bantam hen beginner crochet pattern by miss witchcrafts betsy may be little but she s big on attitude - and cuddles designed as a bantam hen she s a small plush roughly the size of a softball perfect for little hands to hold or snuggles on the go this is a beginner friendly plush pattern that features a nest add-on for this little chick to chill in at the end of a long day instagram @misswitchcrafts + ribblr https //ribblr com/shop/miss-witchcrafts + ravelry https //www ravelry com/people/misswitchcrafts miss witchcrafts i m kiki a craft enthusiast and pet parent based in northern california i learned the basics of crochet nearly 30 years ago and in recent years have been designing crochet patterns i believe in accessibility and clear instruction within written crochet patterns so each of my designs is written to be enjoyed by crafters of all skill levels firmly within my granny era i adore cottagecore themes fresh florals and the versatility of simple stitches thank you for your interest in my design - i hope it serves you well and please don t hesitate to reach out with any questions or pattern assistance needs i would love to see your work please feel free to tag me on instagram - @misswitchcrafts m a t e r i a l s n e e d e d 6 super bulky yarn see details below 8mm hook yarn needle to weave in ends stitch markers optional snips fiber fill safety eyes optional but recommended s t i t c h e s & a b b r e v i a t i o n s u s t e r m s st / sts stitch / stitches chain/chs chain s sl slip stitch single_crochet single_crochet skip skip half_double_crochet half_double_crochet space - space double_crochet double_crochet yo - yarn over treble_crochet triple/treble_crochet magic_ring magic_ring fo fasten_off repeat * - repeat what is between * * pattern pattern notes additional stitch decrease - single_crochet 2 together aka decrease this will decrease 2 stitches into 1 how to do the stitch insert the hook in the next st yo and draw up a loop there should be two loops on the hook insert the hook in the next st yo and draw up a loop there should be three loops on the hook yo and draw through all 3 loops on the hook to complete the stitch recommended yarn bernat blanket yarn or other weight 6 super bulky yarn ideal for plush toys small amounts of red and orange will be needed to add finishing touches - this can be done with the same type of yarn or anything you have on hand i use 10mm plastic safety eyes but you can substitute any eyes you have on hand that won t slip through the stitches or use black yarn to embroider eyes instead which would make the plush safer for all ages work in a spiral or slip_stitch to join
